channel.title: Sidepodcast // All for F1 and F1 for All
channel.description: Join Christine as she guides you through all the happenings in the fast-paced world of Formula 1. Bringing you information, gossip, statistics and humour, with the odd race report thrown in for good measure. But don't think this is news churned out the normal way - the lady tells it like it is. Conspiracy theories, honest opinions and irreverent musings all add up to a refreshing listen.
channel.copyright: © Copyright 2007-2012 Christine Blachford. All rights reserved
channel.dc:creator: Christine Blachford
channel.dc:subject: Formula 1

image.title: Sidepodcast // All for F1 and F1 for All

channel.itunes:author: Christine Blachford

item.title: Sauber turn F1 inside out
item.dc:creator: Mr. C
item.description: For the past two years mechanics in Hinwill have been spending their downtime slicing a chassis in half, lengthways. From the tip of the nose to the very edge of the brake light, they are now able to reveal exactly what makes up a modern F1 car.
item.content:encoded:
For the past two years mechanics in Hinwill have been spending their downtime slicing a chassis in half, lengthways. From the tip of the nose to the very edge of the brake light, they are now able to reveal exactly what makes up a modern F1 car.

See more on Sauber turn F1 inside out
item.itunes:subtitle: Swiss team bare all to show their best side // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: An Aside with Joe - It's Mercedes-Benz who are the fly in the ointment
item.dc:creator: Mr. C
item.description: The French Riviera is Joe's locale of choice, as we quiz the man on all matters Formula 1. Ahead of the Monaco Grand Prix and with a quarter of the season under his belt, the top of a mountain turns out to be a good place to view the big picture.
item.content:encoded:
The French Riviera is Joe's locale of choice, as we quiz the man on all matters Formula 1. Ahead of the Monaco Grand Prix and with a quarter of the season under his belt, the top of a mountain turns out to be a good place to view the big picture.

See more on An Aside with Joe - It's Mercedes-Benz who are the fly in the ointment
item.itunes:subtitle: F1 conversation from a very nice location // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: An Aside with Joe - Oh my God, we're selling, selling, selling!
item.dc:creator: Mr. C
item.description: Returning unscathed from Bahrain, Joe takes time out from some well earned rest to talk all things Formula 1, including recognising terrific performances, who looks ordinary on a bad day, and the all new boisterous Nico Rosberg.
item.content:encoded:
Returning unscathed from Bahrain, Joe takes time out from some well earned rest to talk all things Formula 1, including recognising terrific performances, who looks ordinary on a bad day, and the all new boisterous Nico Rosberg.

See more on An Aside with Joe - Oh my God, we're selling, selling, selling!
item.itunes:subtitle: Unravelling F1's politicised mess // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: An Aside with Joe - It's more than just numbers
item.dc:creator: Christine Blachford
item.description: Joe catches up with news and gossip ahead of the Bahrain Grand Prix, from being bombarded with propaganda to the win that shouldn't have been. There is discussion of that press release, receiving a round of applause in hospitality, plus how not to react when things go badly.
item.content:encoded:
Joe catches up with news and gossip ahead of the Bahrain Grand Prix, from being bombarded with propaganda to the win that shouldn't have been. There is discussion of that press release, receiving a round of applause in hospitality, plus how not to react when things go badly.

See more on An Aside with Joe - It's more than just numbers
item.itunes:subtitle: Joe opens up about being infamous and celebrating a century // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: Feet Up Friday - Doesn't Bernie look tired?
item.dc:creator: Christine Blachford
item.description: This week on Feet Up Friday, we trial the new live streaming, live commenting show, whilst talking about the trials at Force India, how great China was, and what is really going on with Bernie.
item.content:encoded:
This week on Feet Up Friday, we trial the new live streaming, live commenting show, whilst talking about the trials at Force India, how great China was, and what is really going on with Bernie.

See more on Feet Up Friday - Doesn't Bernie look tired?
item.itunes:subtitle: Live streaming returns to Sidepodcast with our fourth FUF show // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: Feet Up Friday - I need big, not small
item.dc:creator: Christine Blachford
item.description: At last, Feet Up Friday returns with our late thoughts on the first two races and our predictions for the upcoming Chinese Grand Prix. We also discuss the latest news and views from the sport we love. This week, we ponder how 2012 compares to 2011 in racing terms, what cocktails would make a good podcast, and the difference between Mr C's attitude to F1 and mine. We argue about Bernie's misguided quotes, and discuss a new breed of driver.
item.content:encoded:
At last, Feet Up Friday returns with our late thoughts on the first two races and our predictions for the upcoming Chinese Grand Prix. We also discuss the latest news and views from the sport we love. This week, we ponder how 2012 compares to 2011 in racing terms, what cocktails would make a good podcast, and the difference between Mr C's attitude to F1 and mine. We argue about Bernie's misguided quotes, and discuss a new breed of driver.

See more on Feet Up Friday - I need big, not small
item.itunes:subtitle: A roundup of the two completed races and the news we've missed // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: An Aside with Joe - They just whipped a quick billion out
item.dc:creator: Mr. C
item.description: We wake Joe from his jet-lagged slumber to talk all things motor racing, following a hectic start to the season. Discussion covers the need for a figurehead at Williams, how Pirelli redefined the challenge for 2012, filing stories over Iran, plus what a difference an engine makes.
item.content:encoded:
We wake Joe from his jet-lagged slumber to talk all things motor racing, following a hectic start to the season. Discussion covers the need for a figurehead at Williams, how Pirelli redefined the challenge for 2012, filing stories over Iran, plus what a difference an engine makes.

See more on An Aside with Joe - They just whipped a quick billion out
item.itunes:subtitle: Joe explains his new role with Caterham Cars // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: Feet Up Friday - Head down Saturday
item.dc:creator: Christine Blachford
item.description: Our second Feet Up Friday in as many weekends does not set a precedent for weekly podcasting, dya hear? However, this time out finds an overexcited Mr C and a chilled out Christine chatting about the current happenings in F1, plus the latest updates to the site. Starting with some feedback on the last show, there's an update on the best names in F1, and a quick shout out to a new blog in town.
item.content:encoded:
Our second Feet Up Friday in as many weekends does not set a precedent for weekly podcasting, dya hear? However, this time out finds an overexcited Mr C and a chilled out Christine chatting about the current happenings in F1, plus the latest updates to the site. Starting with some feedback on the last show, there's an update on the best names in F1, and a quick shout out to a new blog in town.

See more on Feet Up Friday - Head down Saturday
item.itunes:subtitle: Discussing site updates, F1 news and the Angry Birds helmet // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: Feet Up Friday - What's on your F1 mind?
item.dc:creator: Christine Blachford
item.description: For 2012, we bring you a new concept in podcasting - the relaxed, Friday night, glass in hand, F1 discussion. Touching on topics such as a lonely Petrov, Joe's real name and Kamui on Twitter, this is Feet Up Friday.
item.content:encoded:
For 2012, we bring you a new concept in podcasting - the relaxed, Friday night, glass in hand, F1 discussion. Touching on topics such as a lonely Petrov, Joe's real name and Kamui on Twitter, this is Feet Up Friday.

See more on Feet Up Friday - What's on your F1 mind?
item.itunes:subtitle: The first edition of our new podcast // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: An Aside with Joe - 153 years in Formula One
item.dc:creator: Christine Blachford
item.description: The 2012 F1 season starts right here, right now as Joe returns from a hectic off-season to catch up on all the news that's fit to discuss in motor sport. We talk negotiating ploys from Bernie, crash testing in component form, plus drivers with money versus drivers without.
item.content:encoded:
The 2012 F1 season starts right here, right now as Joe returns from a hectic off-season to catch up on all the news that's fit to discuss in motor sport. We talk negotiating ploys from Bernie, crash testing in component form, plus drivers with money versus drivers without.

See more on An Aside with Joe - 153 years in Formula One
item.itunes:subtitle: Joe prepares for the 2012 season with talk of mentors and protests // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: F1 Debrief - 2012 Season Preview Megamix
item.dc:creator: Christine Blachford
item.description: The new F1 season is creeping ever closer, and to raise the anticipation just a little bit further, a fine selection of the Sidepodcast community are taking their best guess at what is going to unfold over the next twelve months. From thoughts on the return of Kimi Räikkonen, to hopes and dreams over how the Austin Grand Prix will turn out, we've got it all covered. Force India's driver line-up, whether Lewis Hamilton will be back on form, and what Ferrari need to do are all given airtime. There's even a surprising amount of Rubens Barrichello.
item.content:encoded:
The new F1 season is creeping ever closer, and to raise the anticipation just a little bit further, a fine selection of the Sidepodcast community are taking their best guess at what is going to unfold over the next twelve months. From thoughts on the return of Kimi Räikkonen, to hopes and dreams over how the Austin Grand Prix will turn out, we've got it all covered. Force India's driver line-up, whether Lewis Hamilton will be back on form, and what Ferrari need to do are all given airtime. There's even a surprising amount of Rubens Barrichello.

See more on F1 Debrief - 2012 Season Preview Megamix
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sidepodcast community gather to make their predictions // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: An Aside with Joe - I'm sure he'll do an averagely, perfectly, alright job
item.dc:creator: Mr. C
item.description: With the F1 season over for another year, Joe takes time to look back on 2011, on undervalued engineers, on the human damage of Formula 1 and on the kind of places the sport should be going.
item.content:encoded:
With the F1 season over for another year, Joe takes time to look back on 2011, on undervalued engineers, on the human damage of Formula 1 and on the kind of places the sport should be going.

See more on An Aside with Joe - I'm sure he'll do an averagely, perfectly, alright job
item.itunes:subtitle: Joe calls in to review the 2011 season and what's in store for the off-season // All for F1 and F1 for All

item.title: A lap of the Buddh International Circuit
item.dc:creator: Mr. C
item.description: Not content with winning both the driver and constructor championships this month, Red Bull Racing have found time to put together an animated preview of the sole newcomer to this season's schedule, the Indian Grand Prix at the Buddh International Circuit.
item.content:encoded:
Not content with winning both the driver and constructor championships this month, Red Bull Racing have found time to put together an animated preview of the sole newcomer to this season's schedule, the Indian Grand Prix at the Buddh International Circuit.

See more on A lap of the Buddh International Circuit
item.itunes:subtitle: Red Bull return with a preview of the newest addition to the F1 calendar // All for F1 and F1 for All
